urls.title: Homepage
urls.description: At Let Grow, we believe kids are smarter and safer than our culture gives them credit for. Therefore, through school programs, parent empowerment, research and advocacy, we are making it easy, normal and legal to give kids back some of childhood's rocket fuel: independence.

urls.title: The Science of Reading and the Media: Is Reporting Biased? - Literacy Research Association
urls.description: The Science of Reading and the Media: Is Reporting Biased? Maren Aukerman, The University of Calgary   At least two questions are critical for assessing journalistic quality. First, does the writing exhibit bias that distorts the truth? And, second, does the writer understand the topic deeply enough to report on it accurately? In the field […]

tweets.text: This short article does a good job of breaking down the problems with popular science of reading reporting from APM and NYT.  H/T to @plthomasEdD  https://t.co/m6zj4S8rY8

urls.title: How The Culture Of Achievement Is Hurting Our Schools - TeachThought PD
urls.description: Achievement sounds great doesn’t it? What parent doesn’t want their child to achieve? What teacher doesn’t hope their students achieve at a high level? Of course achievement in general is a good thing but the Culture of Achievement created by high stakes accountability measures is having a dangerous effect on education.
